You got to go to Fort Mifflin??!!!! You SUCK!!! :P

Someday I will be there=
 :)


  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: laurie@... 
  To: EVP=
-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Friday, May 15, 2009 9:57 PM
  Subject: Re: [=
EVP-ITC] Re: Just wondering,







  I like graveyards..thats the geneaolo=
gist in me. I could spend all day in one taking photos and trying to figure=
 out the family relationships and the relationships of the names to local h=
istory...I haven't done much investigating in them, but I was once called t=
o investigate some activity at a cemetery - I was called by the caretaker.
=

  I have run boxes and held evp sessions in cmeteries, parks, my backyard,=
 places that are reputedly haunted, places that are not supposed to be haun=
ted and it seems to not matter - I have gotten evps and rtsc at all of the =
types of places - it doesnt seem to matter whether the  place is haunted or=
 not. I will say that the best and clearest communications I have in my col=
lection are from haunted locations -  Fort Mifflin and a haunted apartment =
building. 

  Now, if a place is "haunted" by a specific personality, the s=
pirit is already there in the place (theoretically), so  when you begin you=
r session (evp or itc) your chances of talking to that particular spirit sh=
ould be better, but this isn't always the case - the only thing I can say a=
fter the year of ITC sessions I have done is that it does seem to me like t=
here is some component missing from the equation that might give us, the op=
erator, better control and I am not sure what it is, but I have had several=
 dreams about itc lately and they were directing me to introduce colors and=
 tones. 


  -----Original Message-----

m
